intro: Sphaerostigma heterophyllum, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. The plant bears woody pods containing edible, kidney-shaped seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
